title: Overnight Oats
description: Perfect grab-and-go breakfast that's ready when you wake up!
instructions: Mix oats, milk, chia seeds, and sweetener in a jar. Stir well. Add berries and peanut butter on top. Refrigerate overnight. Grab and go in the morning! You can make 3-4 jars at once for the whole week.

title: Upgraded Ramen Bowl
description: Turn instant ramen into a nutritious, filling meal!
instructions: Cook ramen noodles according to package directions. In the last minute, crack an egg into the pot and add frozen vegetables. Drain, then mix with soy sauce, sriracha, and protein. Top with green onions. Boom - a real meal!

title: One-Pan Chicken & Veggies
description: Minimal cleanup, maximum flavor - perfect for busy weeknights!
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, carrots, bell peppers)
instructions: Preheat oven to 425Â°F. Toss chicken and vegetables with oil and seasonings on a sheet pan. Arrange lemon slices on top. Bake for 25-30 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Makes great leftovers!

title: Gourmet PB Toast
description: Elevate your basic peanut butter toast game!
instructions: Toast bread until golden. Spread peanut butter evenly. Arrange banana slices on top. Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with cinnamon. Add granola for extra crunch. Protein-packed and delicious!

title: Microwave Mug Omelet
description: No stove? No problem! Perfect for dorm cooking.
instructions: Spray a large microwave-safe mug with cooking spray. Whisk eggs and milk in the mug. Add vegetables and half the cheese. Microwave for 45 seconds, stir, then microwave another 30-45 seconds. Top with remaining cheese. Let cool for 1 minute before eating.

title: Garlic Oil Pasta
description: A classic Italian dish with just 5 ingredients - simple but elegant!
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large pan and add sliced garlic. Cook until golden (don't burn!). Add red pepper flakes. Toss drained pasta with the garlic oil, add parsley and pasta water if needed. Serve with Parmesan.

title: Power Smoothie Bowl
description: Instagram-worthy breakfast that's actually nutritious!
ingredients: Toppings: granola, fresh fruit, coconut flakes, chia seeds
instructions: Blend frozen fruits, yogurt, milk, and honey until thick and creamy. Pour into a bowl. Arrange your favorite toppings in rows or patterns. Take a photo (it's required), then enjoy! The key is keeping it thick so toppings don't sink.

title: Loaded Quesadilla
description: Better than any restaurant version - and way cheaper!
ingredients: Sour cream and guacamole for serving
instructions: Layer cheese, protein, vegetables, and salsa on one tortilla. Top with second tortilla. Cook in a pan with oil for 2-3 minutes per side until golden and cheese is melted. Cut into wedges and serve with sour cream and guacamole.

title: Ultimate Rice Bowl
description: Customizable, filling, and perfect for using up leftovers!
ingredients: 1/2 cup protein (chicken, tofu, beans, or egg)
2 tbsp sauce (teriyaki, soy sauce, or sriracha mayo)
instructions: Warm rice in bowls. Add your choice of protein and vegetables. Drizzle with sauce. Top with avocado, sesame seeds, and green onions. Mix it all up and enjoy! Make several at once for easy meal prep.

title: 2-Ingredient Banana Pancakes
description: Healthy pancakes that seem too good to be true - but they work!
ingredients: Maple syrup and berries for serving
instructions: Mash bananas until smooth. Whisk in eggs, cinnamon, and vanilla until well combined. Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium-low heat. Pour small portions of batter and cook for 2-3 minutes per side. Serve with syrup and berries. They're more delicate than regular pancakes, so be gentle when flipping!

title: Peanut Butter Freezer Bars
description: protein packed breakfast bars that stay good in the fridge, best in the freezer.
instructions: combine peanut butter, honey, and olive oil in a large bowl, mix. next, add the soft banana, almond milk, and eggs. In a separate bowl, mix together oats, wheat flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon

title: Pumpkin Cottage Cheese Pancakes
description: Protein-packed pancakes with fall flavors
ingredients: 1/3 cup egg whites or 2 whole eggs
instructions: Add all ingredients up to the butter or oil to a blender. Blend until smooth, adding a splash of milk if needed for a thinner consistency. Allow batter to rest for at least 5 minutes. It may seem runny at first, but it will thicken as it rests, resulting in firmer pancakes. Heat pan or griddle to low-medium heat and add oil or butter. When the pan is hot, pour desired amount of batter onto pan (This recipe should make about 8 small pancakes). Cook about 3 minutes then flip and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes. These pancakes are fairly moist so you may need to adjust the time as needed. Add desired toppings and enjoy!

title: Tofu Pancakes
description: High-protein vegan pancakes that are surprisingly fluffy
instructions: Add all ingredients except the oil or butter to a blender and blend until smooth. Heat pan or griddle to low-medium heat and add oil or butter. When the pan is hot, pour desired amount of batter onto pan (This recipe should make about 10 small pancakes). Cook about 5 minutes then flip and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes. These pancakes are fairly moist so you may need to add a couple extra minutes. Add desired toppings and enjoy!

title: Whole Wheat Pancakes
description: Classic fluffy pancakes with added nutrition
instructions: Stir wet ingredients into a medium bowl. Stir dry ingredients into a bigger bowl. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined (You should still have some lumps). Heat a pan or griddle on low-medium heat. Add the oil or butter. Scoop desired amount of batter onto pan and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until small bubbles start to form and pop on the surface of the pancakes. Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes. You should be able to make 8-10 small pancakes.

title: Egg Burritos (or Tacos)
description: Customizable breakfast wraps perfect for meal prep
ingredients: 2 medium-sized flour tortillas or 4 corn tortillas
optional mix-ins: chopped bell pepper, chopped spinach or kale, sliced mushrooms, meat, etc.
optional toppings: salsa, avocado, hot sauce, cheese, diced tomato, etc.
instructions: Beat the eggs and milk (if using) in a bowl. Heat a pan over medium and add oil. If using any mix-ins, cook those now. Once mix-ins are cooked to your preference, pour in the egg mixture and add desired spices. Lower heat to low-medium and stir constantly until eggs are cooked to your desired consistency. Heat the tortillas in another skillet or the microwave, then serve with the eggs and desired toppings.

title: Huevos Rancheros
description: Classic Mexican breakfast with fried eggs and seasoned beans
ingredients: 1 can beans, drained (15 oz.)- black or pinto work best
optional seasonings for the beans: salt and pepper, chili powder, cumin, tajin, smoked paprika, garlic powder
instructions: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add the oil. When the pan is hot, crack the eggs and fry them to desired firmness. Put eggs on a plate and cook tortillas in the same pan. Transfer the tortillas to the plate and put the beans in the skillet. Season the beans as desired and cook until most of the liquid has evaporated. Place the beans on the plate, add salsa and other desired toppings, and dig in!

title: Scrambled "Chilaquiles"
description: A kid-friendly take on the classic Mexican dish
ingredients: Toppings: avocado, cheese, cooked beans, bell pepper
instructions: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add the oil. Cut the corn tortillas into bite-sized pieces and fry in the skillet until lightly browned. Crack the eggs into the pan and stir to combine with the tortillas. Add the salsa and mix again. Once eggs are fully cooked, serve with desired toppings and enjoy!

title: Un-boring Oatmeal
description: Elevated oatmeal with endless topping possibilities
ingredients: topping combo ideas: peanut butter, banana, and chocolate chips; diced apples, pumpkin seeds and maple syrup; berries and chia seeds; fried egg and avocado (savory option)
instructions: Bring the water and salt to a boil in a saucepan. Stir in the oats and reduce the heat to medium. Add in the butter, sweetener, and cinnamon. Stir constantly until the oatmeal reaches your desired consistency. The longer it cooks, the more dense and mushy it will be. Add desired toppings and enjoy!

title: Multigrain Cooked Cereal
description: Hearty breakfast cereal packed with whole grains
ingredients: 4 cups total of any combination of the following: oat groats, quinoa, brown rice, barley, rye, wheat berries, black lentils
Optional mix-ins: 1/2 cup pumpkin seeds, 1/3 cup chia seeds, 1/3 cup flax seeds
instructions: Place all ingredients into the Instant Pot and set on high pressure for 30 minutes. Once done cooking, allow pressure to release naturally for 10 minutes. Serve with your choice of sweetener, milk, and fruit.

title: Applesauce Grape-Nuts Casserole
description: Comforting breakfast casserole perfect for chilly mornings
ingredients: Cream, milk, or coconut milk to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Pour applesauce into a casserole pan and spread evenly. Scatter Grape-Nuts over applesauce and sprinkle cinnamon on top. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until warmed through. Serve with cream, milk, or coconut milk!

title: Breakfast Parfait
description: Layered breakfast with yogurt, granola, and fruit
ingredients: 1 cup fruit such as: fresh or frozen and thawed berries, sliced bananas, diced mango, sliced apples, Spiced Apple Compote, Berry Compote
instructions: Layer ingredients as desired in a bowl or cup.

title: Peanut Butter Chocolate Smoothie
description: Protein-rich smoothie that tastes like a milkshake
ingredients: 1-2 scoops chocolate protein powder (or 2 tbsp cocoa powder)
Optional nutrition boosters: 1 tbsp chia seeds, 1 tbsp flax seeds
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.

title: Berry Banana Smoothie
description: Antioxidant-rich smoothie with hidden greens
ingredients: Optional nutrition boosters: 1 tbsp chia seeds, 1 tbsp flax seeds, 1 tbsp beetroot powder
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.

title: Tropical Smoothie
description: Transport yourself to the tropics with this refreshing smoothie
ingredients: Optional nutrition boosters: 1 tbsp chia seeds, 1 tbsp flax seeds, 1-inch chunk fresh ginger
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.

title: Indian Butter Chicken
description: Rich and creamy Indian curry made easy in the Instant Pot
ingredients: 9 cloves minced garlic or 3 tsp garlic powder
3 tsp minced ginger or 1 tsp ginger powder
2 tsp garam masala or curry powder
2 lbs frozen chicken thighs or breasts
To add after cooking: 4 tbsp butter or coconut oil, 8 oz coconut milk, 1 14-oz can chickpeas, 2 tsp garam masala, 1/2 cup chopped cilantro (optional)
instructions: Place tomatoes and spices into the instant pot and stir. Add the chicken and set the cooker for 15 minutes on high pressure. Once the cooker is finished, allow the pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes. Remove the chicken and cut into bite-sized chunks (or use a fork to separate). Blend together the rest of what's in the cooker with an immersion blender. Alternatively, pour into a regular blender and blend until smooth. Allow the sauce to cook for a couple of minutes- this will help the sauce stay thicker when you add the butter and coconut milk later. Put the blended sauce and chicken chunks back into the pot and add the butter, coconut milk, chickpeas, garam masala, and cilantro. Stir until everything is incorporated and serve over rice!

title: Arroz con Pollo
description: One-pot Spanish rice and chicken dish
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs. chicken breasts or boneless thighs, diced
1 1/2 cups rice (jasmine or basmati tastes best)
1 cup frozen peas or frozen mixed veggies
instructions: Press the SautÃ© button on the instant pot and add oil. Once the oil is hot, add chicken and cook until golden brown (around 5 minutes). Transfer cooked chicken to a bowl. Add a bit of water or broth to the pot, then add onions, bell peppers, celery, and garlic. Stir until onion is translucent. Press the Cancel button, then add all the spices except the cilantro, stir and cook for about 30 seconds. Add a little more liquid if it sticks to the pan. Stir in the chicken broth, cooked chicken, and half of the chopped cilantro. Pour in the can of tomatoes (with the liquid) and spread out but don't stir. Add the rice and push it down until it's immersed, but don't stir in. Put the lid on and pressure cook for 6 minutes, then allow pressure to release naturally for 10 minutes. When pressure is released, stir in the frozen veggies and the remainder of the cilantro.

title: Vegan (or not) Chili
description: Hearty bean chili that's satisfying with or without meat
ingredients: 2 Beyond Beef patties or 1 lb. ground beef
1 bell pepper (yellow, orange, or red), diced
3 14-oz cans other beans (kidney, pinto, and cannellini)
instructions: Press the SautÃ© button on the instant pot and place the patties or ground beef in. Cook until browned, breaking it up into tiny pieces. Remove the meat and place in a separate bowl. Add a splash of water to the pot to unstick any meat bits, then add in the onions and bell pepper. Cook until onions are translucent. Add the meat back to the onion mixture, then stir in all the spices. Dump in all the cans, stir, and continue cooking until heated through. If you want more depth of flavor, push the slow cook button on the Instant Pot and set for 2-3 hours. This will allow the flavors to combine more.

title: Taco Soup
description: Easy one-pot soup with all your favorite taco flavors
ingredients: 1-2 lbs frozen chicken breasts or thighs (depending on the ratio you prefer)
4 15-oz cans of beans such as: black beans, pinto beans, cannellini beans, kidney beans
Optional toppings: cilantro, avocado, tortilla chips or strips, plain Greek yogurt or sour cream, cheese
instructions: Add all ingredients except for the toppings to the instant pot and cook on high pressure for 15 minutes. Shred the chicken with a fork, then serve into bowls and add desired toppings.

title: Crispy Tofu Rice Bowls
description: Asian-inspired bowls with crispy tofu and savory sauce
ingredients: For the Tofu: 28 oz extra firm tofu, 4 tbsp corn starch, 1 1/2 tsp salt, oil for cooking
Sauce for the tofu: 4 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp garlic powder, 2 tsp rice vinegar, 1 tbsp cornstarch, 1/2 cup water
instructions: Drain and pat the tofu dry, then tear into bite-sized chunks (you can also slice or cube the tofu if preferred). Place tofu chunks into a bowl and sprinkle corn starch and salt over them. Toss or stir until the tofu is well-coated. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Use more oil if you want crispier tofu. Place as much tofu as will fit in the pan in a single layer without the pieces touching. You may need to cook them in a couple batches to ensure crispiness. Mix the sauce ingredients together in a bowl and set aside. Once all the tofu is crispy, add the sauce and continue to cook until sauce is warm and at desired consistency. Serve over rice and broccoli.

title: Mexican Rice Bowls
description: Build-your-own burrito bowls with endless customization
ingredients: Topping options: shredded chicken, cooked ground beef, salsa, Pico de Gallo, guacamole, lettuce, cheese, plain Greek yogurt or sour cream
instructions: Place rice and beans in a bowl and add desired toppings!

title: Greek Bowls
description: Mediterranean-inspired bowls with Greek flavors
ingredients: 1-2 cups cubed potatoes (sub fresh greens if desired)
1/2 cup sliced grape or cherry tomatoes
Optional: Greek dressing, Crumbled feta cheese, Sliced kalamata olives (can sub black olives), Couscous or cooked whole grains, Tzatziki sauce
instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Mix cubed potatoes with oil, salt, and pepper, then place on a cookie sheet and cook for 45 minutes, or until desired tenderness is reached. Place cooked potatoes in a bowl and top with the remaining ingredients.

title: Italian Pasta Salad
description: Classic pasta salad with Italian flavors
ingredients: Optional, but super tasty: 1/4 cup capers
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions, and prepare remaining ingredients while the pasta cooks. Drain pasta and rinse with cool water. Place in a large serving bowl. Add the remaining ingredients, toss, and serve!

title: Greek Pasta Salad
description: Mediterranean pasta salad with feta and olives
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions, and prepare remaining ingredients while the pasta cooks. Drain pasta and rinse with cool water. Place in a large serving bowl. Add the remaining ingredients, toss, and serve!

title: Savory Potato Salad
description: Classic potato salad that's never sweet
ingredients: 10 small or 5 large potatoes (russet work best, but any kind will do)
pickle juice or apple cider vinegar to taste
instructions: Clean and chop the potatoes into bite-sized pieces, then place in a large pot and fill with cold water until potatoes are covered. Place on the stove over high heat. Once the water is boiling, turn the heat down to low and let simmer for 5 minutes. Check to see if the potatoes are done (if you can easily pierce them with a fork, they're done). If not, add a few more minutes. Drain the potatoes and rinse with cool water. Chop the boiled eggs, pickles, and celery into desired size and add to a large bowl. Stir in the rest of the ingredients, then add the potatoes.

title: Easy "California Rolls"
description: Homemade sushi rolls that are easier than you think
ingredients: 2 cups sushi rice (or other white rice in a pinch)
Optional: salt and sugar to taste
1/4 cup Mayo (more or less to taste)
instructions: Rinse rice thoroughly, then place in instant pot with the water and cook on "Rice" setting. Allow pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes. If adding salt and sugar, sprinkle it into the vinegar and microwave for about 30 seconds, then stir to dissolve. Transfer rice to a large bowl or other container and gently mix in the vinegar. Allow to cool (I like my sushi rice still slightly warm-unconventional but delicious!) Prepare veggies and set aside. Chop imitation crab finely and mix with mayo. Place a sushi nori sheet on a sushi mat or other flexible mat (even a gallon size plastic bag works!) Wet your hands, then place desired amount of rice on the sushi nori, patting with your hands until it's spread evenly. Place desired amount of crab mixture and veggies on the rice, then roll, cut, and enjoy!

title: Pizza
description: Homemade pizza with your choice of toppings
ingredients: 1 batch Yeasted Pizza Dough, Protein Pizza Dough or No-rise Pizza Dough
Italian seasoning or basil and oregano (fresh or dried)
Toppings: mozarella cheese, pepperoni, cooked sausage, bell pepper, onion, mushrooms, artichoke hearts, sundried tomatoes, olives
instructions: Prepare dough and set aside (make ahead if using yeasted dough so it will have time to rise). Mix tomato sauce with desired amount of spices. If you have time, place in a saucepan and cook down over low heat to bring out the flavors. Cut veggies if using and prepare all other desired toppings. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Roll out the pizza dough and place on greased pizza pans or cookie sheets. Spread the sauce, then place toppings. Cook for 20-25 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly and toppings are cooked.

title: Sheet Pan Dinner
description: One-pan meals with protein, carbs, and veggies
ingredients: Per person from each of the following categories:
1/3 cup Carb: diced potatoes, diced sweet potatoes
1-2 cups Veggies: diced squash, chopped carrots, fresh green beans, asparagus, fresh broccoli florets, fresh cauliflower florets, brussels sprouts
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Prepare desired ingredients and place on a large sheet pan. (Feel free to cook the protein separately as proteins and veggies often have different cooking times.) Drizzle with olive oil and toss to coat everything, then sprinkle salt and spices over the top. Bake for 45 minutes (may need more or less time depending on the size of the chunks).

title: Chia Pudding
description: Make-ahead pudding that's perfect for breakfast or snacks
ingredients: topping ideas: mango and coconut milk, sliced banana and nuts, granola and dried fruit or berries
instructions: Stir chia seeds, milk, and sweetener together in a bowl, mason jar, or other container. Make sure there are no clumps of seeds. Place in the fridge and allow to set overnight. Add toppings of your choice and enjoy!

title: Mango Coconut Rice
description: Thai-inspired sweet rice with tropical flavors
ingredients: 1 cup jasmine, basmati, or other white rice
To top: fresh or thawed frozen mango chunks, coconut flakes
instructions: Place all ingredients in the Instant Pot and cook on high pressure for 4 minutes. Allow pressure to release naturally for 10 minutes. Serve with mango chunks and coconut flakes.

title: Peanut Butter Balls
description: No-bake energy balls perfect for snacking
ingredients: Optional mix-ins: 1/4 cup coconut flakes, 1/4 cup chocolate chips, 1/4 cup pumpkin seeds
instructions: Place all ingredients in a bowl and mix thoroughly. Roll into bite-sized balls and store in the refrigerator or freezer.

title: Vietnamese Spring Rolls
description: Fresh and healthy rice paper rolls with dipping sauce
ingredients: Veggie options: Cucumber, sliced into thin spears; Thinly sliced carrots; Shredded cabbage
Protein options: crispy tofu, cooked shrimp, cooked chicken, shelled edamame
Extras: vermicelli noodles, lettuce leaves (for holding the rolls)
instructions: Cook your protein choice if needed, then place in a bowl or other container. If using, prep noodles according to package directions. Prep all the veggies and lay them out in bowls or plates so they're ready to use. Fill a large bowl or other container with warm water. Dip one rice paper sheet in so that the entire sheet is wet. This should only take about 5 seconds per sheet (it gets too flimsy if you let it sit longer.) Place the wet rice paper on a plate and put the desired protein, veggies and noodles in the center, ensuring plenty of room around the edges. Roll the rice paper around the filling as you would a burrito, tucking the ends in so they stick together. Place spring roll on a leaf of lettuce to keep it from sticking to the plate or other rolls. Repeat with all remaining ingredients and serve with dipping sauce.

title: Spiced Apple Compote
description: Warm apple topping perfect for pancakes and oatmeal
ingredients: 2 tbsp sweetener (honey, agave, or maple syrup works best)
instructions: Chop the apple into small, thin chunks. Add apple, water, sweetener and cinnamon to a saucepan and cook over medium heat until the apples are soft. Mix the cornstarch and tbsp of water, then stir into the apple mixture. Turn the heat to low and let simmer until the mixture thickens to a syrup.

title: Berry Compote
description: Sweet berry sauce perfect for pancakes and yogurt
ingredients: 3 tbsp sweetener (honey, agave, or maple syrup works best)
instructions: Put the berries, water, and sweetener into a saucepan over medium heat. Cook until the water starts to simmer, then smash the berries with a fork or a potato masher. Add in the lemon juice if desired. Mix the cornstarch and tbsp of water, then stir into the berry mixture. Turn the heat to low and let simmer until the mixture thickens to a syrup.

title: Blended Cottage Cheese Spread
description: Protein-rich spread for pancakes and toast
instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Alternatively, place ingredients in a bowl and use a hand blender.

title: Date "Caramel" Spread
description: Natural sweetener spread made from dates
ingredients: 1 cup pitted dried dates (I prefer Medjool, but any kind will do!)
instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Add more hot water if a thinner consistency is desired.

title: Pico de Gallo
description: Fresh Mexican salsa with tomatoes and cilantro
ingredients: 8 small or 4 large tomatoes, finely diced
1-2 jalapeno or serrano peppers, finely diced
instructions: Place all ingredients in a bowl and stir! The salt, garlic powder, and lime juice may need adjusted according to your preferences.

title: Guacamole
description: Creamy avocado dip with Greek yogurt boost
instructions: Place all ingredients in a bowl and mash well. The garlic powder and lemon or lime juice may need adjusted according to your preferences.

title: Hummus
description: Creamy chickpea dip perfect for vegetables
instructions: Place chickpeas and 1/4 cup of the liquid in a blender along with the lemon juice and spices. blend until smooth, adding a bit more chickpea liquid if it's too thick. With the blender still going, drizzle in the olive oil, adding more or less depending on how thin you want the consistency.

title: Tzatziki
description: Greek yogurt sauce with cucumber and dill
ingredients: 1/2 cup grated cucumber (the finer the better)
1 tbsp chopped fresh dill (or 1 tsp dried dill)
instructions: Place all ingredients in a bowl and stir!

title: Greek Dressing
description: Tangy dressing perfect for salads and bowls
ingredients: 1/3 cup red wine vinegar (can sub apple cider vinegar in a pinch)
instructions: Place all ingredients into a bowl, jar, or other desired container and mix well.

title: Creamy Italian Dressing
description: Rich and flavorful dressing with parmesan
ingredients: 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar (less if you don't like your dressing very acidic)
1-2 tbsp mayo (more if you want it creamier)
1 tsp Italian seasoning (or combo of basil and oregano)
instructions: Place all ingredients into a bowl, jar, or other desired container and mix well.

title: Peanut Sauce
description: Thai-inspired peanut dipping sauce
ingredients: 1/4 cup hoisin sauce (can substitute with mixture of 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp lime juice, and 1 tbsp rice vinegar)
1 tsp agave or honey (if peanut butter is unsweetened)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat and add garlic. Once garlic is fragrant, reduce heat and stir in remaining ingredients. Allow to gently bubble, being sure to not let the peanut butter burn. Once ingredients are well incorporated and warmed through, transfer to a bowl or other container and serve! Optional: garnish with sesame seeds if desired.

title: Nuoc Cham
description: Vietnamese dipping sauce with fish sauce and lime
ingredients: 1 tsp unseasoned rice vinegar (more if desired)
3 tbsp fish sauce (can use soy sauce in a pinch, but it won't taste the same)
red pepper flakes, sliced Thai chili, or chili garlic sauce, to taste
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix until thoroughly combined. Adjust amounts of each ingredient as desired. Serve with Vietnamese Spring Rolls.

title: Dessert Hummus
description: Sweet chickpea dip perfect for fruit and treats
ingredients: 2 cans chickpeas, drained and rinsed well
1/2 cup honey, agave, or maple syrup
1 cup melted chocolate chips or 2/3 cup cocoa powder (feel free to adjust according to your taste)
1/2 cup melted coconut oil or peanut butter
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.

title: Peanut Butter Yogurt Dip
description: High-protein dip perfect with fruit
instructions: Add all ingredients to a bowl and mix well. Serve with sliced fruit.

title: Soft Dinner Rolls
description: Fluffy homemade dinner rolls perfect for any meal
ingredients: 4 cups whole wheat flour (more as needed)
1 tsp salt (1 1/2 if using unsalted butter or oil)
1/4 cup honey, agave, or maple syrup
2 tbsp active dry or instant yeast
instructions: Mix wheat flour and salt together in a large bowl and set aside. In another bowl, mix together all wet ingredients, then sprinkle yeast over the top and stir in. Pour the mixture into the dry ingredients and mix well. When a dough begins to form, turn it out onto a floured surface and knead for 2-3 minutes, adding flour if dough is too sticky. Place the dough back in the bowl and cover with a cloth. Allow it to rise until doubled in size (30 min-1 hr. depending on how warm your environment is.) Once dough is risen, turn it onto the counter and knead a few times, then cut into 24 equal portions. Shape them into rolls, then place them on a cookie sheet and allow to rise again until doubled in size. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F, then cook rolls for about 25 minutes. The tops should be golden brown.

title: Naan Bread
description: Soft Indian flatbread perfect with curry
ingredients: 1 teaspoon instant or instant dry yeast
instructions: Place all dry ingredients into a bowl and mix to combine. Mix yogurt and milk together, then add to dry ingredients. Stir until everything is well incorporated, then knead dough until smooth (about 10 minutes- 5 if you're fast!) Place dough ball back in bowl and cover with a cloth. Allow to rise for about 2 hours or until dough has doubled in size (will rise faster in a warmer environment). Once dough is risen, separate into 8 portions and roll them out on a floured surface. Heat a skillet over high heat and place 1 rolled-out portion of dough in the pan and cover with a lid. Cook until bubbles form on the surface (1-2 minutes), then flip the naan bread and cook for about 1 minute on the other side. You should see dark spots on both sides if the heat is high enough. Brush with butter and sprinkle on garlic powder and cilantro if desired.

title: Flour Tortillas
description: Homemade soft flour tortillas
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour (more as needed)
1 cup very warm water (heat in microwave for 1 min.)
instructions: Put flour, salt, and oil into a bowl and mix until well incorporated. Gradually add the warm water while mixing, then stir or knead until the dough is smooth. Separate dough into 8 equal portions and roll out on a floured surface. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and cook each tortilla for 1-2 minutes on each side.

title: Yeasted Pizza Dough
description: Classic pizza dough with yeast for the best flavor
ingredients: Wet: 1 1/2 C warm water, 1 tbsp active dry or instant yeast, 2 tsp honey or agave, 2 tbsp olive oil
Dry: 3 cups flour (more as needed), 1 tsp salt
instructions: Put wet ingredients into a large bowl and mix to combine. Let sit for about 5 minutes. Add dry ingredients and mix well. Once a dough begins to form, knead for about 5 minutes. Allow dough to rise in the bowl, covered, for about an hour or until doubled in size. Use as soon as possible. This dough doesn't taste good if stored in the fridge for more than a day.

title: Protein Pizza Dough
description: Pizza dough with added protein from milk and egg
ingredients: Wet: 1 C warm milk, 1 egg or 1/4 C egg whites, 1 tbsp active dry or instant yeast, 2 tsp honey or agave, 2 tbsp olive oil
Dry: 3 cups flour (more as needed), 1 tsp salt
instructions: Mix wet ingredients together in a large bowl and let rest for 5 minutes. Add dry ingredients and cheese if using, and mix until well incorporated. Knead dough until smooth, about 5 minutes. Cover and let rise for 1 hour or until doubled in size. Use for pizza or breadsticks as soon as possible.

title: No-rise Pizza Dough
description: Quick pizza dough when you don't have time to wait
ingredients: Dry: 2 cups flour (more as needed), 3 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp salt
instructions: Mix dry ingredients together, then add wet ingredients. It's ok if the dough is a little sticky because if it's too dry it's a doozy to roll out! Knead the dough for about 5 minutes, then roll out on a floured surface and use!

title: Greek Yogurt Lemon Bars
description: Healthier lemon bars with Greek yogurt
ingredients: Crust: 1 cup flour, 1/3 cup melted coconut oil or butter, 1/4 cup honey, agave, or maple syrup, 1/4 tsp salt
Filling: 1/2 cup Greek Yogurt, 3 eggs, 1/3 cup honey, agave, or maple syrup, 1/3 cup lemon juice (fresh is best), 1 tsp vanilla, 1/4 tsp salt, 2 tbsp flour
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F and grease an 8x8 pan. Place all crust ingredients in a bowl and mix well, then dump into prepared pan and pat down until the entire bottom of the pan is covered. Bake the crust for about 15 minutes and let it cool while you make the filling. Add all filling ingredients to a bowl and whisk well or use an immersion blender (you could also just throw it into a regular blender.) Pour the filling into the pan and cook for another 30 minutes or until set. Let cool completely before enjoying (good luck with that!) Cut and sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.

title: Black Bean Brownies
description: Fudgy brownies with hidden black beans for extra fiber
ingredients: 1 cup pitted dates (OR 2/3 cup honey, maple syrup or agave)
1 1/2 cups chocolate chips (NOT OPTIONAL- these brownies only taste good with the chocolate chips added!)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F and grease an 18x13 baking pan (can use slightly larger or smaller if needed). Drain and rinse the black beans VERY thoroughly. Place all ingredients except the chocolate chips into a food processor or heavy-duty blender (you'll need some real power for this mixture). Blend until completely smooth. As smooth as possible. Transfer to a bowl and mix in the chocolate chips (save some to place on top if desired). Pour batter into the prepared pan, sprinkle the extra chocolate chips on top, and cook for about 15 minutes. They may need a few extra minutes, but they'll finish setting once they cool. Once done, allow to cool fully before cutting. Store in the fridge.

title: Chickpea Cookie Dough
description: Edible cookie dough made with chickpeas
ingredients: 3 cups chickpeas (2 cans, drained and rinsed thoroughly)
instructions: Add all ingredients except for chocolate chips to a blender or food processor. If you use a blender, you'll need the tamper to push everything down as it blends. Blend until smooth, then dump into a bowl. Stir in chocolate chips. Serve with apple slices or enjoy by the spoonful!

title: Instant Pot Rice
description: Perfect rice every time using your pressure cooker
ingredients: 2 cups jasmine, basmati, or other white rice
instructions: Place rice in the instant pot and rinse well. Drain the water off (it's ok if there's still some left). Add the 2 cups of water, close the lid, and press the rice button. Once the cooking time is over, allow the pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes, then let the rest of the pressure out by turning the valve to "venting." Fluff with a fork or rice spoon and serve, or allow to cool slightly before placing in meal prep containers.

title: Instant Pot Beans
description: Perfectly cooked beans from scratch with great flavor
ingredients: 5 cups water, chicken stock, or vegetable stock
optional add-ins: chilis in adobo sauce, green chilis, diced tomatoes
instructions: Turn the Instant Pot onto Saute mode and add the oil. Once oil is hot, add diced onions and cook until they're translucent. Add the rest of the ingredients and stir. Set the Instant Pot to pressure cook for 1 hour. Once it's done, allow pressure to naturally release fully. This may take up to 30 minutes.

title: Instant Pot Shredded Chicken
description: Flavorful shredded chicken perfect for meal prep
ingredients: 3 lbs frozen chicken breasts or thighs
For salsa chicken: 3-4 cups salsa, 2 tsp garlic powder, 2 tsp smoked paprika, 2 tsp cumin, 2 tsp salt
For green chili chicken: 14 oz chopped green chilis (more or less according to desired spice level), 2 tsp garlic powder, 2 tsp salt
instructions: Add chicken to the instant pot, along with all ingredients for your desired for your desired flavor. Cook on high pressure for 15 minutes, then allow pressure to fully release naturally. Shred chicken with a fork.

title: Oven Roasted Chicken Breasts
description: Simple seasoned chicken breasts for meal prep
ingredients: For basic chicken: salt, pepper, garlic powder
For Mexican chicken: salt, pepper, garlic powder, smoked paprika, cumin, chili powder
For Greek chicken: salt, pepper, garlic powder, oregano, basil, lemon juice
instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Place chicken breasts on a cookie sheet and season as desired. Cook for 30-40 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 165 degrees F. Cut into chunks and store for future use.

title: Hearty Granola
description: Homemade granola packed with nuts and seeds
ingredients: 1 cup roughly chopped nuts such as: pecans, almonds, walnuts
1/2 cup seeds such as: pumpkin seeds, sunflower seeds, chia seeds, flax seeds
1/2 cup honey, agave, or maple syrup
1/2 cup oil (coconut, olive, or avocado oil taste best)
Optional mix-ins: 1/2 cup dried fruit, chocolate chips, coconut flakes
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F and prepare a large cookie sheet by greasing or placing a silicone mat. Place all dry ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Warm sweetener, oil, and vanilla in a separate bowl in the microwave for 30 seconds (this will ensure easier mixing if using honey). Mix the sweetener mixture into the dry ingredients until everything is evenly coated. Spread granola evenly onto the cookie sheet. Cook granola for 15 minutes, then stir, spread again, and cook for 8-10 more minutes. Allow granola to fully cool, then break into pieces and add your mix-ins.
